name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. John Edward HILL, Appellant

judges: Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. John Edward HILL, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
The appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: James J. Karl, Chief Public Defender, Public Defender’s Office, for John Edward Hill.
James C. Madenspacher, Dist. Atty., Susan E. Moyer, District Attorney’s Office, for Com.
casebody.head_matter:
759 A.2d 912
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania, Appellee, v. John Edward HILL, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued May 2, 2000.
Decided Oct. 17, 2000.
James J. Karl, Chief Public Defender, Public Defender’s Office, for John Edward Hill.
James C. Madenspacher, Dist. Atty., Susan E. Moyer, District Attorney’s Office, for Com.
Before FLAHERTY, C.J., and ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, NIGRO, NEWMAN and SAYLOR, JJ.
